intro: Anthocometes, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it a striking appearance. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Anthocometes is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these habitats.
